isis.stitle: ELECTRICAL SYSTEM TROUBLESHOOTING GUIDE - 9800 - 18 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS EATON RTLO-14618 AND RTLO-16618 SERIES - INSTALL - RIGHT COUNTERSHAFT ASSEMBLY

step1.para: Remove blocking from right countershaft assembly and place it parallel to the mainshaft assembly. Mesh the marked tooth of the right countershaft drive gear with the remaining set of two marked teeth on the main drive gear ( Figure 260).

figure.caption: Figure 260. Mesh Marked Tooth of Right Countershaft Drive Gear With Marked Teeth on Main Drive Gear

step1.para: Insert the countershaft support tool or blocking in the rear bearing bore ( Figure 261).

figure.caption: Figure 261. Insert Countershaft Support Tool or Blocking in Rear Bearing Bore

step1.para: Position the front countershaft bearing in the front bearing bore ( Figure 262). Use the proper bearing driver to set the bearing (inset).

figure.caption: Figure 262. Position Front Countershaft Bearing in Front Bearing Bore

step1.para: Install the retainer washer and bolt. Make sure to match roll pin in retainer with inner bearing hole ( Figure 263). Tighten bolt to 90 to 120 ft-lbs. (122 to 163 N·m).

figure.caption: Figure 263. Install Retainer Washer and Bolt

step1.para: Position the countershaft rear bearing in the rear bearing bore ( Figure 264). Use the proper bearing driver to seat the bearing in the bore.

figure.caption: Figure 264. Position Countershaft Rear Bearing in Rear Bearing Bore

step1.para: With bearing installation complete, install the snap ring in the right countershaft rear groove ( Figure 265).

figure.caption: Figure 265. Install Snap Ring in Right Countershaft Rear Groove

step1.para: Move the reverse gear to the rear on the mainshaft and use a screwdriver to engage sliding clutches with all forward speed gears. A sliding clutch that will not engage with a gear indicates the gear set is not in proper mesh. The bearings of the right countershaft would then need to be removed and the drive gear set retimed.

note.para: Do not engage sliding clutches with more than one gear at the same time. This will lock the gearing and prevent the mainshaft and countershaft assemblies from rotating.
